tweets.text: The people of Newcastle subjected to a Saturday night stink as usual courtesy of @RedIndustries2 good job they did all that capping to solve the problem isn't it @EnvAgency? #stopthestink https://t.co/LIRC09yAng

So on @StaffordshireCC #StaffordshireDay we went to CHESHIRE to get relief from the plague of Newcastle, #WalleysQuarrey home of #walleyslandfillLTD We looked at houses. Moving away after 41 years, and teaching and raising a family here, now seems the only option @EnvAgencyMids

The @EnvAgency calculate that Affinity Water are over abstracting local chalk streams to the tune of about 430 million litres of water per day.

That's almost 10% of the world's total supply of chalk streams degraded for profit.

Let's talk about a clean conscience shall we. https://t.co/J8nQmVNWlv

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

@WiseBirding @DevonWildlife @Natures_Voice @EnvAgency @kiergroup Who is actually carrying out the wetland restoration Chris?

@WiseBirding @DevonWildlife @Natures_Voice @EnvAgency @kiergroup So if the ecologists do find nesting birds (I assume they have Sch 1 licences if looking for Cetti‚Äôs) - what happens then?  Are those areas left?

urls.title: Start of the close season: How do we protect our breeding fish at this time of year?
urls.description: Matt Buck, Fisheries Technical Specialist for the Midlands, explains how close season helps protect our breeding fish. Well the evenings are getting lighter, and across the country fish are starting to move out of their winter haunts - a sure ‚Ä¶

tweets.text:
The coarse fish close season runs until 15th June inclusive. This means it‚Äôs illegal to fish for coarse fish in rivers.

Don‚Äôt forget, there are plenty of still waters or canal coarse fisheries where you can fish. 

Learn more: https://t.co/u6IhTpkgUB https://t.co/9Tpaa6XWIW

urls.title: Buy a rod fishing licence
urls.description: How and where to buy or upgrade a rod fishing licence for salmon, trout, freshwater fish, smelt and eels in England and Wales.

tweets.text:
Fishing this bank holiday weekend?

Even though it‚Äôs illegal to fish for course fish in rivers until 15th June inclusive, there are still plenty of places you can fish legally.

Don‚Äôt forget, you must have a valid fishing rod licence. Buy a licence at: https://t.co/fx56eQ45pG https://t.co/c3FpXEsbQE

tweets.text: My kitchen, 2 miles away and up a hill from #WalleysQuarry, in Keele has suddenly been filled with the smell of landfill! @EnvAgencyMids sort it out! This is now a human rights issue! People can't enjoy their own homes. #StopTheStink

@Helen_Clinton @RedIndustries2 @EnvAgency Already feel like I'm living that nightmare! Early morning when I wake up I could definitely play an extra part as a zombie for I can't even open my eyes or function after breathing in fumes all night üôà

@ClareDinnisEA is this what you had in mind whilst ignoring us, except when you could get yourself on TV on the back of our suffering? You and your @EnvAgency cronies really are something else üò° @StinkStopthe https://t.co/aklr0RCFPd

@BBCNews These toxic landfill gases are affecting the whole town not just Silverdale. hospitals, schools, care homes, nursery‚Äôs, fire stations, police, keele university, Newcastle college, vets, businesses. All have lodged their concerns yet @EnvAgencyMids let‚Äôs it continue #stopthestink https://t.co/MxgzU5rK0U

tweets.text: Earlier this morning our field team were at a marina in #Goole helping to clear up some oil that had leaked into the water. The pads and bunds are used to contain and soak up the oil and prevent any damage to #wildlife in the nearby rivers. https://t.co/yep6FSvuk2
